entries.meaning: An early, remarkably durable form of photograph (technically a photographic negative), printed on a tin plate, then varnished.
examples: They'll show you tintypes of the kids more often than not, hell, they love em chavalitos.

verbs.description: tintype (third-person singular simple present tintypes, present participle tintyping, simple past and past participle tintyped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To produce a tintype image of.
